meanings.sent1: She botanises in the garden every morning.
meanings.sent2: He botanises different types of flowers for his research.
meanings.sent3: The curious child botanises the leaves, trying to learn more about them.
meanings.sent4: Her mind botanises through the intricate details of each plant she encounters.
meanings.sent5: The botanising scientist carefully examines each petal under the microscope.

meanings.definition: Engages in the scientific study of plants.
meanings.sent1: The botanist botanises various species to understand their characteristics.
meanings.sent2: They botanise the forest to discover new plant species.
meanings.sent3: The student botanises the textbook, absorbing all the information about plants.
meanings.sent4: His passion for botanising plants shines through his detailed research.
meanings.sent5: Botanising the rainforest, she uncovers rare plant species never seen before.

meanings.definition: To explore or examine plants in their natural environment.
meanings.sent1: The nature enthusiast botanises the fields, enjoying the beauty of wildflowers.
meanings.sent2: They botanise the national park to document the diverse plant life.
meanings.sent3: The artist botanises the garden for inspiration for their next painting.
meanings.sent4: His heart botanises the forest, feeling at peace among the trees and flowers.
meanings.sent5: Botanising the meadow, she feels connected to the earth and its wonders.
